resources.string: On your return trip from studying Saturn\'s rings,you hear a distress signal that seems to be coming from surface of Mars.It\'s strange because there hasn\'t been a colony there in years.Even stranger it\'s calling you by name: \"Help me, %1$s,you\'re my only hope.\"

You deftly land your ship near where the distress signal generated.You didn\'t notice anything strange in your fly-by,but there is a cave in front of you.Behind you there is an abandoned rover from early 21st century.

You continue your course to Earth.Two days later,you receive a transmission from HQ saying that they have detected some sort of anomaly on the surface of Mars near an abandoned rover. They ask you to investigate but ultimately the choice is yours because your mission has already run much longer than planned and supplies are low.
Head back to Mars to investigate

Your EVa suit is equipped with a headlamp,which you use to navigate the cave.After searching for a while your oxygen level is starting to get pretty low.You know you should go to refill your tank,but there\'s a very faint light up ahead.
Refill at ship and explore the rover

The rover is covered in dust and most of the solar panels are broken.But you are quite surprised to see the on-board system booted up and running.In fact,there is a message on the screen;\"%1$s, come to 24.543634,-81.369061.\" Those coordinates aren\'t far but you don\'t know if your oxygen will last for a trip there and back.

After a long walk slightly uphill,you end up at the top of a small crater. You look around and you are overjoyed to see you favourite android, %1$s-S114.It had been lost in a previous mission to Mars! You take it back to the ship and fly back to Earth.
You arrive home on Earth. While your mission was a success you forever wonder what was sending that signal. Perhaps a future mission will be able to investigateâ€¦
